nodes.name: cancelOrders
cancelAllOrdersForTradingPair
cancelAllOrders
cancelAllOrdersForTradingPairOfOwner
cancelAllOrdersOfOwner
cancelOrders
cancelAllOrdersForTradingPair
cancelAllOrders
cancelAllOrdersForTradingPairOfOwner
cancelAllOrdersOfOwner

cancelAllOrders(uint256).details: Set a cutoff timestamp to invalidate all orders whose timestamp        is smaller than or equal to the new value of the address's cutoff        timestamp.        msg.sender is the broker of the orders for which the cutoff is set.

params.cutoff: The cutoff timestamp, will default to `block.timestamp`        if it is 0.

cancelAllOrdersForTradingPair(address,ad.details: Set a cutoff timestamp to invalidate all orders whose timestamp        is smaller than or equal to the new value of the address's cutoff        timestamp, for a specific trading pair.        msg.sender needs to be the broker of the orders you want to cancel.

params.cutoff: The cutoff timestamp, will default to `block.timestamp`        if it is 0.
params.token1: The first token of the trading pair
params.token2: The second token of the trading pair

cancelAllOrdersForTradingPairOfOwner(add.details: Set a cutoff timestamp to invalidate all orders whose timestamp        is smaller than or equal to the new value of the address's cutoff        timestamp, for a specific trading pair.        This function can be used by brokers to cancel orders of an owner.        msg.sender needs to be the broker of the orders you want to cancel.

params.cutoff: The cutoff timestamp, will default to `block.timestamp`        if it is 0.
params.owner: The owner of the orders the broker wants to cancel
params.token1: The first token of the trading pair
params.token2: The second token of the trading pair

cancelAllOrdersOfOwner(address,uint256).details: Set a cutoff timestamp to invalidate all orders whose timestamp        is smaller than or equal to the new value of the address's cutoff        timestamp.        This function can be used by brokers to cancel orders of an owner.        msg.sender needs to be the broker of the orders you want to cancel.

params.cutoff: The cutoff timestamp, will default to `block.timestamp`        if it is 0.
params.owner: The owner of the orders the broker wants to cancel

cancelOrders(bytes).details: Cancel multiple orders.      msg.sender needs to be the broker of the orders you want to cancel.

params.orderHashes: Hashes of the orders to be cancelled.
